content: ribcage top pattern things you will need cotton yarn 5mm hook needle optional stitch marker sternum 3 double_crochet in mc 3ch turn 3x double_crochet increase 3ch turn *6dc 3ch turn* repeat 5x 2dc 1dc decrease 2dc 3ch turn 5dc 3ch turn increase double_crochet double_crochet increase double_crochet increase double_crochet 3ch turn 8dc 3ch turn 2dc half_double_crochet 2sc half_double_crochet 2dc 3ch turn 1ch 4sc in the side clavicle 1 *4dc 3ch turn* repeat 4x double_crochet 1dec double_crochet double_crochet *3dc 3ch turn* repeat ** until it reaches spine comfortably 3sc tie off spine 2dc in a mc 3ch turn double_crochet increase double_crochet 3ch turn *3inc double_crochet 3ch turn increase double_crochet 4 double_crochet increase double_crochet 3ch turn 8 double_crochet 1ch turn 3sl st 3ch double_crochet in the same stitch 2dc* repeat ** until there s 3 vertebrae 3inc double_crochet 3ch turn increase double_crochet 4 double_crochet increase double_crochet 3ch turn 8 double_crochet 1ch turn 3sc in the side 3ch turn clavicle 2 *3dc 3ch turn* repeat until the same length as 1st clavicle double_crochet increase double_crochet double_crochet 3ch turn *4dc 3ch turn* repeat** 3x 4sc ribs top 3 ribs are 3dc wide bottom 2 are 2dc wide the length and placement depends on person s size and shape
